description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

《Mr.Curiosity》收录在Jason Marz于2005年推出的专辑《Mr.A-Z》。这首歌的主旨是在失意时对小时候的自己的怀念。“好奇先生”指孩童时期无忧无虑的自己，如今已成熟的自己却常常受伤常常感到孤独，这首歌以类似书信的单方面交谈形式很微妙而温暖的描述了每个人对自己童年的怀念和成长后的忧伤。[来自百度百科]

模唱部分：

Mr. Curiosity
- Jason Mraz -
Hey Mr. Curiosity
Is it true what they've been saying about you
Are you killing me
You took care of the cat already
And for those who think it's heavy
Is it the truth?
Or is it only gossip

Call it mystery or anything
Just as long as you'd call me
I sent the message on did you get it when I left it
See, this catastrophic event
It wasn't meant to mean no harm
But to think there's nothing wrong is a problem

I'm looking for love this time
Sounding hopeful but it's making me cry
Love is a mystery
Mr. Curious...

讲解：

模唱：

想要得到主持人专业的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Mr. Curiosity

description:
First though, actor Peter Firth on the big screen, from a teenage appearance in Zeffirelli's St. Francis picture, Brother Sun, Sister Moon back in 1972, right up to one of this week's releases, in which he plays commander Harry Pearce, the spy master role he's held through the ten series of the television series Spooks, a spin-off from the long-running TV series, with ambitions to alert carry plot, insider expelled yet still working on the outside. It's smiley light with mistrust the keynote. So is this a feature-length episode with more ambitious settings? When Firth came into the studio, we talked about the move from small to big screen.

"It's a very difficult transition to make and I think there's evidence of that for end of British film industry and there're lots and lots of shows over the last 40, 50 years have tried to make that transition and not quite made it. But Spooks, the TV show, always felt like a film trying to get out of the television. We shot it on film, which, back in 2001, was unusual. Most drama had switched to digital formats and... But we decided to use film because it had a more gritty film, more... We're just more usual to the genre, to the spy genre. That, and given the epic size of the stories, which were big for television, it just felt like it was a film. So that kind of inspired the idea and production that maybe one day we'll be able to make a film."
